source_sentence: 「爾時毒龍見火神堂，四面一時烔燃熾盛，唯有如來所坐之處，其處寂靜，不見火光。
translation: "It was then that the poisonous dragon saw the fire deity's hall, which was instantly blazing hot on all sides, except for where the Tathāgata was sitting, which was silent and had no firelight.

source_sentence: 見已漸詣向於佛所，到佛所已，即便涌身入佛鉢中，而說是偈：「『若人百千億萬歲，　　一心祭祀此火神，　　彼輩不能斷去瞋，　　如今勝世尊忍辱。
translation: After he saw this, he gradually went toward the Buddha, and when he arrived, he rushed into his bowl and spoke this verse, "Suppose someone for 10,000,000,000 years had single-mindedly sacrificed to this fire deity, and they were unable to end their anger, but now they're more tolerant than the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 一切天人世界內，　　唯有世尊大丈夫，　　諸被瞋恚重病纏，　　世尊能與忍辱藥。』
translation: Among all the gods and humans in the world, there's only the Bhagavān, a great man who's tormented by the serious illness of anger, and the Bhagavān can give him the medicine of patience.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊過彼夜後，至明清旦，手擎於鉢，將彼毒龍，來至優婁頻蠡迦葉所坐之處。
translation: "After the night passed, the Bhagavān then, in the early morning, put his bowl in his hand and led that poisonous dragon to where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was sitting.

source_sentence: 到已即告彼迦葉言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: When he arrived, he told him, 'Kāśyapa, my lord!

source_sentence: 此是毒龍，汝等所畏，不能入於火神堂者，此即是彼。
translation: 'This is the poisonous dragon that you fear, which prevents you from entering the fire deities' hall.

source_sentence: 以我威火，滅其毒火，今故將來以示汝輩諸梵志等。』
translation: Because of my authoritative fire, I extinguished its poisonous fire, so I'll show it to you priests and others in the future.'

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『是時彼夜分已過，　　世尊來至迦葉所，　　鉢中盛於毒龍示，　　手擎安置著彼前。』
translation: And there was a verse that said, 'It was then, after the nighttime hour had passed, that the Bhagavān came to Kāśyapa with a bowl full of poisonous dragons and placed it in front of him with his hand.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻蠡迦葉，作如是念：『此大毒龍，為自入於大沙門鉢？
translation: "It was then that Ulū Vairocana Kāśyapa thought, 'Did this great poisonous dragon get itself into the great brāhmaṇa's bowl?'

source_sentence: 為大沙門神通力故，教其入中？』
translation: Is it because of the great ascetic's supernormal powers that he teaches him to enter the middle?'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知彼優婁頻螺迦葉心之所念，知已即便手所執鉢，自然展向優婁頻螺迦葉之邊。
translation: Knowing what that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was thinking, the Bhagavān then knew that he could carry his bowl in his hand and naturally spread it out to the side of Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 時彼毒龍，九頭大項，引頸欲向優婁頻螺迦葉身邊。
translation: That venomous dragon with nine heads and a huge neck was about to draw his neck toward Ulūkaśālī.

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉見龍舉頭欲向己邊，心生驚怖，却縮身住，自以兩手，掩覆其面。
translation: Seeing the dragon's head raised in the direction of his own, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa became frightened, withdrew, and covered his face with his own two hands.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed that Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa and said, 'You, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 何故縮身，如是驚怖？
translation: Why is the shrunken body so frightened?

source_sentence: 汝心畏也？』
translation: Are you afraid in your mind?'

source_sentence: 迦葉報言：『如是如是！
translation: Kāśyapa replied, 'So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 大德沙門！
translation: A great virtuous monk!

source_sentence: 我實畏也。』
translation: I'm really afraid.'

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa, my dear!

source_sentence: 汝莫怖畏。』
translation: Don't be afraid!'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即以偈頌語迦葉言：「『我昨夜來教化彼，　　其更不能恐怖他，　　其若今欲螫於仁，　　世間終無有此法。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke to Kāśyapa in verse, saying, 'Last night, I came to teach him, but he couldn't have been afraid of others; if he wanted to sting a human being now, there would never be such a thing in the world.

source_sentence: 假使天崩倒於地，　　大地破碎如微塵，　　須彌移離本處安，　　諸佛口終不妄語。』
translation: Suppose the sky collapsed to the ground and the earth shattered like dust, Sumeru moved away from his original place and was at peace, and the mouths of the buddhas would never speak falsely.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: "At the time, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa thought, 'This great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大威神力！
translation: Great Mighty Spiritual Power!

source_sentence: 大有功能！
translation: Greatly functional!

source_sentence: 乃設如是神力之火，滅彼毒龍毒惡熾火。
translation: They then set fire with such divine power to extinguish the poisonous dragon's venomous blazing fire.

source_sentence: 其事雖然，而猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: Even though it did so, it still didn't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊取彼毒龍，發遣安置彼大海外鐵圍山間。
translation: The Bhagavān then took that poisonous dragon and sent it away to be placed on that great overseas mountain of Tie Wei.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa then said to the Buddha, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 彼毒龍今安在何處？』
translation: Where is that poisonous dragon now?'

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa, you!

source_sentence: 彼之毒龍，我今已遣安置於彼鐵圍山間。』
translation: Now, I've sent that poisonous dragon to be placed there among the iron mountains.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉見佛示現是神通已，心生歡喜，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: "Seeing this demonstration of the Buddha's superknowledge, Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa rejoiced and said to the Buddha, 'Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 願恒住此，我當常請供奉飯食。』
translation: May you always stay here, and I will always ask for food to offer.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊默然受彼優婁頻螺迦葉等請。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān quietly accepted their invitation, including Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa's.

source_sentence: 「（或復有師作如是說：『佛告優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是言：「仁者迦葉！
translation: "(Perhaps another teacher said, 'The Buddha told Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa to say this, "You, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 若汝等輩，能依時節告我食時，如是則我受仁者請。」
translation: If you people can tell me when to eat according to the seasons, then I'll accept your invitation, sir."

source_sentence: 時迦葉言：「我等當告。」』
translation: Kāśyapa then said, "We will tell you."'

source_sentence: ）「爾時，色界淨居諸天即說偈言：「『此是大慈世尊力，　　善能降伏大毒龍，　　其三迦葉事火神，　　所有精進力當滅。』
translation: ) "It was then that the gods of the form realm who live in the Pure Land spoke a verse, saying, 'This is the power of the Bhagavān, who's good at subduing great poisonous dragons, and the three Kāśyapa gods who serve the fire deities and whose energy for effort will be extinguished.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊從彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，漸漸而行，去於優婁頻螺迦葉處所不遠，有一林名差梨尼迦(隋言斫枝即出乳汁)，在於彼林，經行而住。
translation: "Not far from where that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa had received his meal, the Bhagavān traveled gradually, and there was a grove named Cāḷinīka (Sui dialect for cutting branches to make milk) that was walking through and staying at that grove.

source_sentence: 是時，四鎮四大天王身出勝光，當於夜半，下來世間，以天身光，普照彼林，向於佛所。
translation: At the time, four of the major celestial kings in the township emitted a brilliant light from their bodies, and at midnight, they descended into the world and used the light from their bodies to shine universally in that forest as they headed for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到佛所已，頂禮佛足合掌而却，各隨來方，住立一面，向佛曲躬，低頭頂禮，如猛火聚，出大炎光，照尼迦林。
translation: When they arrived, they bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, put their palms together, withdrew, followed their directions, stood to one side, bowed their heads to the Buddha, bowed their heads, and saluted him like a cluster of fierce fires that emitted a great, fiery light that shone in the Nika Groves.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，晨向佛所。
translation: "After that night, Ulūka Punarvasu-Kāśyapa headed for the Buddha in the morning.

source_sentence: 到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: When he arrived, he said to the Buddha, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 食時將至，飯食辦具。
translation: The time for eating is approaching, and the meal is ready.

source_sentence: 未審昨夜四人是誰？
translation: We don't know who the four people were last night.

source_sentence: 身出最勝微妙光明，而於夜半，照此林樹，來到於此大沙門邊。
translation: The most excellent and subtle light emanating from his body shines brightly from this forest at midnight, and he comes to this great monk's side.

source_sentence: 到已頂禮，却住一面，低頭合掌，恭敬立住，譬如火聚，出大勝光。』
translation: When he arrived, he paid homage, withdrew to one side, bowed his head with his palms together, and stood respectfully, like a ball of fire that emits a great, brilliant light.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: "At that point, the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa, you!

source_sentence: 彼四人者，是四天王，來詣我所，從於我邊欲諮問法。』
translation: Those four people are the four heavenly kings who came to me and asked about the teaching from my side.'

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉心如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa thought, 'This is a great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大有威神！
translation: Great is the authoritative power!

source_sentence: 大有威德！
translation: Greatly dignified!

source_sentence: 乃有四大天王下來，詣於其邊欲請問法；威力雖然，但其不得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: Then, four great celestial kings came down and asked about the teaching, and although they were powerful, they didn't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊即至優婁頻螺迦葉所住之處，飯食訖已，後還向彼林內經行，寂靜而住。
translation: "At that point, the Bhagavān went to where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying, finished his meal, and then went back into the forest to walk around and stay there in silence.

source_sentence: 是時，忉利帝釋天王，放身最勝上妙光明，於夜半時，普照彼林，來詣佛所。
translation: At the time, the king of the Indra Heaven, the Terrible One, radiated his most excellent and sublime light, which shone universally in that forest at midnight, and came to visit the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到已頂禮佛世尊足，却住一面，合十指掌，向佛而立，譬如火聚，出大焰光，倍勝於前四天王身，明照顯赫，不可為比。
translation: When he arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Bhagavān, withdrew to one side, put his palms together with his ten fingers, and stood facing the Buddha like a cluster of fires that emitted a great blazing light, twice as bright and vivid as the bodies of the four preceding heavenly kings, which could not be compared.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜已，往詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: "After Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa had passed that night, he went to the Buddha, and when he arrived, he said to him, 'Venerable monk!

source_sentence: 食時已至，飯食辦具。
translation: The time for eating has arrived, and the meal is ready.

source_sentence: 未審昨夜光明是誰？
translation: We don't know who the light was last night.

source_sentence: 於夜半時，身出最勝大光明來，到已頂禮，合十指掌，向一面立，乃至猛焰倍四天光。』
translation: At midnight, the most excellent great radiance emanates from his body, and when he arrives, he salutes, joins his palms with his ten fingers, and stands to one side, even as his fierce flame multiplies the four heavenly lights.'

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa, you!

source_sentence: 彼是忉利天主帝釋，來詣我邊，欲聽法故。』
translation: That's Indra, the lord of the Heaven of Thirty, who came to us because he wanted to hear the teaching.'

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'This is a great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大有威德！
translation: Greatly dignified!

source_sentence: 乃令帝釋來詣其邊，欲聽於法；威力雖然，而猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: He then caused Indra to come to him, wanting to hear the teaching; despite his prowess, he still hadn't attained the fruit of the arhat like I am now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊從彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還向彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he had received his meal at the side of that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān went back to that forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 時，夜摩天於夜半時，身出勝光，來詣佛所，到已合掌，向佛頂禮，却住一面，乃至略說，此大沙門！
translation: At midnight, Yama gods, a brilliant light emanating from their bodies, came to the Buddha, put their palms together when they arrived, paid homage to him, and withdrew to stand to one side, saying, 'This is a great ascetic!'

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 大有威神！
translation: Great is the authoritative power!

source_sentence: 乃令於彼須夜摩天，來欲聽法；威德雖然，其猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。
translation: He then caused that god Śuyāma to come to him wanting to hear the teaching; despite his authoritative qualities, he still wouldn't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊從彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還向彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he had received his meal from that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān returned to that forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 時，兜率天於夜半時，身出光明，來詣佛所，乃至略說，此大沙門！
translation: At midnight, a ray of light emanated from the body of the Tuṣita Heaven and came to the Buddha, saying, in brief, 'This is a great ascetic!'

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 大有威神！
translation: Great is the authoritative power!

source_sentence: 乃令於彼兜率陀天，來欲聽法；威德雖然，其猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。
translation: He then caused those Tuṣita gods to come to him with the desire to hear the teaching; despite their authoritative qualities, they still wouldn't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊從彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還向彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he had received his meal from that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān returned to that forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 時，化樂天於夜半時，身出光明，來詣佛所。
translation: At the time, at midnight, a ray of light emanated from the transformation gods' bodies, and they came to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到已乃至此大沙門有大威神，乃令化樂天子，下來欲聽受法；威德雖然，其猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。
translation: When he arrived, even though this great ascetic had great authority, he caused the Manojñas to come down and want to hear and accept the teaching; despite his authority, he still wouldn't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊從彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還入彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he had received his meal at the side of that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān went back into that forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 是時，他化自在天子於夜半時，身出光明，來詣佛所，乃至略說，此大沙門，大有威神！
translation: At the time, at midnight, the divine son of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin emitted a bright light from his body and came to the Buddha, saying, in brief, "This great ascetic is quite formidable!

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 乃有他化自在天子，來欲聽法；威德雖然，其猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。
translation: It was then that some other-transformed sovereign celestials came to listen to the teaching, and despite their prowess, they still hadn't attained the fruit of the arhat like I have now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊從彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還向彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he had received his meal at the side of that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān returned to the forest and stayed there for a while.

source_sentence: 是時娑婆世界之主，大梵天王，於夜半時，放身光明，普照彼林，來詣佛所。
translation: At midnight, the ruler of the sahā world, the king of the Brahmā gods, radiated his body in a bright light that shone universally in that forest and came to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到佛所已，合十指掌，頂禮佛足，却住一面，向佛而立，譬如火聚，出大猛焰，勝於已前欲界諸天光明百倍，不可為譬。
translation: When he arrived at the Buddha's place, he joined his palms with ten fingers, saluted the Buddha's feet, withdrew to one side, and stood facing him like a cluster of fires that emitted a great, fierce flame, one hundred times brighter than the brightness of the gods of the desire realm that had existed before, which cannot be likened to anything else.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往詣佛所。
translation: "After Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa had passed through the night, he went to visit the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到佛所已，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: When he arrived, he said to the Buddha, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 食時已至，飯食辦具。
translation: The time for eating has arrived, and the meal is ready.

source_sentence: 未審昨夜，出勝光明，普照林內，來至於此大沙門邊，彼為是誰？
translation: I've never imagined that last night, a brilliant light appeared that shone universally in the forest, and it came to this great monk's border.

source_sentence: 合十指掌，頂禮却住，乃至勝前欲天光明。』
translation: Clasping his palms with ten fingers, he paid homage and withdrew, even to the point of surpassing the brightness of the former desire heavens.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊即告優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: "At that point, the Bhagavān addressed Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa and said, 'You, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 彼所來者，是此娑婆世界之主，大梵天王，來詣我所，欲聽受法。』
translation: That person is the lord of the sahā world, the king of the Brahmā gods, who has come to visit us to hear the teaching.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'This is a great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 大有威神！
translation: Great is the authoritative power!

source_sentence: 乃令娑婆世界之主大梵天王，來至其邊，欲聽於法；威德雖然，其猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: He then caused the lord of the sahā world, King Brahmā, to come to him, wanting to hear the teaching; despite his authoritative qualities, he still wouldn't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊從彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還向彼林。
translation: "After he had received his meal at the side of that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān returned to that forest.

source_sentence: 經行而住。
translation: He walked around and stayed there.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉，居處年常恒共竪立一祭祀法，至其時節，摩伽陀國，一切人民，將好種種上味飲食，噉者食者、舐者[口*束]者，辦具已訖。
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying at a place where he had always established a ritual for years, and at that time, all the people of Magadha had prepared and eaten a variety of delicious foods and drinks, and those who devoured them had eaten and licked them [orally*bunch them].

source_sentence: 明日各各欲來向於優婁頻螺迦葉居處。
translation: On the morrow, each of them wanted to come to where Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa was staying.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉，即於其夜，在自室內，作是思惟：『明日集聚摩伽陀國一切人民，辦具種種無量飲食，欲來我邊修祭祀法，而此瞿曇大德沙門，脫於是會大眾之前，顯示神通勝上之法。
translation: "At the time, that night, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa went inside his room and thought, 'Tomorrow, we'll gather all the people of Magadha to prepare a variety of incalculable foods and drinks and want to come to our place to practice rituals, and this Gautama great virtuous ascetic will escape from this gathering and show the great Dharma of his supernormal powers before the people.

source_sentence: 若如是者，我之所有利養名聞即當著彼，則於我邊或復減少。
translation: If that were the case, I would be attached to that person's reputation for nurturing others, and then my presence might be diminished.

source_sentence: 唯願方便，此大沙門，明日莫來。』
translation: Please make it easy for this great ascetic not to come tomorrow.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知彼優婁頻螺迦葉心所念已，過彼夜後，至欝單越，到彼乞食，於阿耨達大池邊食食訖，還在彼大池邊，少時靜攝，竟還本林，經行而住。
translation: After he had known what that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was thinking, the Bhagavān went to Uttarakuru after the night passed, begged for alms, finished his meal at the large lake at Anavatapta, remained at the large lake, collected himself for a short time, returned to his forest, and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜已，食後往詣佛世尊所，到佛所已，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After he had finished his meal, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān, and when he arrived there, he said to him, 'Venerable monk!

source_sentence: 於食至時，辦具亦訖，未審沙門，何故不來？
translation: When the meal arrived and the preparations were made, why didn't the ascetic who hadn't yet been examined come?

source_sentence: 其事雖然，我猶不忘所有諸食上好味者，我今為仁，猶留一分。』
translation: Even though this happened, I still haven't forgotten all the good tastes of food, and now I'm still keeping a part of it for you, my friend.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: "It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa the benevolent!

source_sentence: 汝昨夜在靜室之中，獨自而坐，可不如是思惟念言：「我於明朝在所居處，年常恒作祭祀之法，摩伽陀國所有男女一切人民，將好種種食飲而來，向於我邊。
translation: "Last night, while sitting alone in your quiet room, you might not have thought and considered, 'Tomorrow morning, when I'm staying at my place of residence, I'll always perform rituals every year, and all the men and women of Magadha will come to me with a variety of good foods and drinks.'

source_sentence: 而此大德沙門瞿曇，恐於彼會眾人之前，出現神通，示上人法，則我所有利養名聞，悉著於彼大沙門邊，我則減少，心私願我明日莫來。」
translation: If this great ascetic, the Gautama, were to show his supernormal powers and teach the Dharma to the people there, then all of my nurturing reputation would be attached to the side of that great ascetic, and I'd be less likely to wish privately that I wouldn't come tomorrow."

source_sentence: 仁者迦葉！
translation: "You, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我於爾時，知仁此心如是想念，過於彼夜，我即騰空，至欝單越，向彼乞食，得已來到阿耨達池，如法而食，隨日多少，在彼經行，還向此林宿止而來。』
translation: At the time, knowing this thought in the mind of a human being, I took to the air after that night, went to Uttarakuru, begged for food from there, got it, went to Anavatapta Pond, ate according to the rules, passed through there according to the number of days, and came back to this forest to stay overnight.'

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'This great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大有神力！
translation: Great is the power of the gods!

source_sentence: 大有威權！
translation: Greatly authoritative!

source_sentence: 感變雖然，其猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也(尼沙塞說)。』
translation: Although they are affected by the transformation, they still don't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now (according to Nisanayana).'

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉，居處年常有一大會，名翼宿日。
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa lived in a place where there was always a big assembly called the Yishu day.

source_sentence: 彼會之日，摩伽陀國數千萬人各來聚集，然其彼會亦有市易，隨諸人輩所須貨買。
translation: On that day, tens of millions of people from the country of Magadha would gather there, but there was also a market at that meeting where people bought whatever they needed.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『明朝此處，若沙門來，所有人民皆觀看彼，不為我等造作齋食。』
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa had this thought, 'Tomorrow morning, if an ascetic were to come here, all the people would look at him and not make a meal for us.'

source_sentence: 彼作如是思惟念已，往詣佛所，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After he had thought this thought, he went to the Buddha and said to him, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 明朝我林修道處所，當作大會，多有眾生，百千聚集，甚大喧鬧，而大沙門！
translation: Tomorrow, when a great assembly is held at my forest retreat, there will be hundreds of thousands of sentient beings gathered there, making a great deal of noise, and a great monk!

source_sentence: 愛樂寂靜，恒行清淨空閑之處。
translation: He loves tranquility and always practices in a pure and uninhabited place.

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: A monk!

source_sentence: 可從此處移去別求靜處彼間而住(此僧祇說)。』
translation: You may move away from this place and seek another quiet place to live (as explained in this monk's commentary).'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊從彼住處，即便移至差梨迦林，至彼林已，心念彼四迦婁羅王，王名可觸，又四提頭賴吒龍王，四水神龍，四大天王，帝釋天主，及餘欲界一切諸天，娑婆世界主大梵天等，並皆念之。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān moved from that place of dwelling to the Cālika Forest, and when he arrived there, he was mindful of the four Kālūra kings whose names were touchable, the four Dhṛtarāṣṭra dragon kings, the four water dragons, the four major celestial kings, the lord of the Indra Heaven, all the other gods of the desire realm, and the lord of the Saṃbha world, the Mahābrahma gods, and so forth.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等四可觸王，迦婁羅等，知佛內心如是念已，出現大風，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉所居住處，飛騰虛空，即時往詣差梨迦林。
translation: "Knowing that the Buddha was thus mindful internally, they produced a great wind that soared through the sky from the place where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying and immediately went to the Chālika Grove.

source_sentence: 到彼處已，頂禮佛足，合十指掌，却住一面，遙覩世尊，向佛頂禮。
translation: When they arrived there, they bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, put their palms together with their ten fingers, withdrew to one side, looked at the Bhagavān from a distance, and paid homage to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「其四提頭賴吒龍王、四水神王，亦知佛心，出大雲雨，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處，飛向差梨迦林。
translation: "Knowing the Buddha's mind, the four Dhṛtarāṣṭra dragon kings and the four water spirit kings also sent out great clouds of rain that flew from Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa's abode to the Chāriputra grove.

source_sentence: 到已頂禮佛世尊足，合十指掌，却住一面，向佛遙敬。
translation: When he arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Bhagavān, put his palms together with his ten fingers, withdrew to one side, and paid a distant homage to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 是時，四方四大天王，亦知佛心，作大端正可喜之身，為人樂見，顯赫威光，照曜自身，悉乘白象，從地湧出，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處，往詣差梨迦林。
translation: Knowing the Buddha's mind, the four great celestial kings in the four directions also created large, correct, and pleasing bodies that were pleasing to the eye and shone with an imposing light that reflected themselves, and they all emerged from the ground on white elephants and headed for the charnel ground from where Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying.

source_sentence: 到已頂禮佛世尊足，乃至合掌，遙敬於佛。
translation: When he arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Bhagavān and joined his palms in reverence for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「爾時，忉利帝釋天王，及欲界天娑婆世界主大梵天王，知佛心念，身出威光，遍照其地，從彼優婁頻螺迦葉居住之處，飛騰虛空，一時往詣差梨迦林，到已頂禮佛世尊足，乃至曲躬遙敬於佛。
translation: "Knowing the Buddha's thoughts, the goddess King of the Thirty-three Celestials and the king of the Saṃbha world in the Desire Realm, the Mahābrahma gods, emitted a mighty radiance from their bodies that shone everywhere on the ground, soared into the sky from where Ulū Vīrṣika Kāśyapa lived, went to the Cālīka Forest in one go, bowed their heads at the feet of the Bhagavān, and bowed their heads in distant reverence to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼處一切人民，見如是眾諸天龍等，心生恐怖，身毛皆竪，即便問彼優婁頻螺迦葉等言：『大德和上！
translation: "At the time, when all the people there saw such a multitude of gods and dragons, their hearts became frightened, and their hair stood on end, so they asked Ulūpiṃśvara Kāśyapa and the others, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 此何物神，作斯變怪？
translation: What kind of god is this that does such strange things?

source_sentence: 非是災也？
translation: Is it not a calamity?

source_sentence: 或當有疫，或大恐怖，或大鬪諍，或有迦吒富單那鬼，及黑闇鬼，而欲來乎？』
translation: Perhaps there will be an epidemic, great fear, a great struggle, a ghost of kaṭapūtana, or a dark spirit that wants to come?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是念：『此必是彼大德沙門威力，作斯神通變也。』
translation: "At the time, Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa thought, 'This must be the power of that great virtuous ascetic who did this miraculous transformation.'

source_sentence: 即便報彼諸大眾言：『汝等一切！
translation: Even then, he reported to the crowd, saying, 'All of you!

source_sentence: 莫恐莫怖！
translation: Don't be afraid, don't be scared!

source_sentence: 莫畏莫驚！
translation: Don't be afraid, don't be alarmed!

source_sentence: 此非災變，亦非疫病，及以鬪諍、諸鬼魅來，當有無畏，當有豐熟，當無怪異，不須恐怖，亦無疾病。
translation: These are not calamities, nor are they epidemics, nor are they fights, nor the coming of ghosts and demons; there will be fearlessness, plenty, and nothing strange; there's no need to be afraid, and there's no illness.

source_sentence: 汝等但當安隱自慰，此事無苦，一切諸相，盡皆大吉。』
translation: All of you should simply be at ease and comforted, knowing that this is not a painful situation and that all signs are very auspicious.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『我今亦可往詣於彼大沙門邊，度量此事，自應當知，何故何變致使如是？』
translation: "At the time, Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa thought, 'Now, I could go over to that great ascetic and measure this, and I should know for myself, why has it changed like this?'

source_sentence: 彼作如是思惟念已，即便往詣佛世尊所，欲至佛邊，如來忽以神通之力，即於其前，化作一箇高峻大山，而彼欲來不能得過，到彼山已，即反迴還。
translation: After he had done so, he went to the Bhagavān and was about to reach him when the Tathāgata suddenly transformed himself into a large, high mountain with the power of his supernormal powers, which he couldn't cross because he wanted to, and when he reached the mountain, he turned around and returned.

source_sentence: 過彼夜後還詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After that night, he went back to the Buddha, and when he arrived, he said to him, 'Venerable monk!

source_sentence: 昨日作何如是變怪？
translation: What kind of strange behavior did you do yesterday?

source_sentence: 我從昔來，在此居停，未曾覩見如斯之事。』
translation: I've never seen anything like this since I stopped here in the past.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即便為彼廣說前事，而彼優婁頻螺迦葉既聞說已，生大希有：『奇特可怪，我多年來在此，恒常祭祀火神，不曾有一旋風之氣至於我邊，況復餘神？
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the preceding events in detail for them, and when he heard what he said, that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa became very excited, 'Strange, amazing! I've been here for years and have always worshipped the fire deity, but not a whirlwind of energy has ever reached me, so why would it be possible for another deity to reach me?'

source_sentence: 然今此處，沙門瞿曇！
translation: Yet here we are, the ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 有大威德，一切諸天，來向其邊。』
translation: 'There's so much power that all the gods come to their side.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即於佛邊，生信向心希有之心。
translation: After that thought, he immediately became confident, dedicated, and hopeful at the Buddha's side.

source_sentence: 即以心請佛世尊云：『願大沙門！
translation: He then mentally invited the Bhagavān, saying, 'May it be, O great ascetic!'

source_sentence: 明日食時，更於我邊，受我微供，若佛實是一切智者，應知我心。』
translation: 'Tomorrow, when you eat, come back to me and accept my humble offerings; if the Buddha really is omniscient, you should know my mind.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，如來即知優婁頻螺迦葉心念，默然而受彼之心請。
translation: After he had this thought, the Tathāgata knew what Ulupaṃkāśyapa was thinking, and he quietly accepted his invitation.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉還其居處，告諸一切摩那婆言：『汝等詣向大沙門邊，量度觀看，其大沙門，作於何事？
translation: "Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa then returned to his abode and addressed all the maṇḍalas, saying, 'Go to that great ascetic and examine him; what is it that he does?'

source_sentence: 為當求食欲著衣行，為當默然寂靜而坐？』
translation: Should you seek food, desire to wear clothes, and walk, or should you sit in silence and stillness?'

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等諸摩那婆，從於優婁頻螺迦葉聞此言已，即便往詣差梨迦林，到已見佛在彼林內樹下思惟寂然而坐，身出光明，照耀彼處，於食知足，不行乞求，默然而住。
translation: Those manas then, having heard those words from Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, went straight to the Śāriputra grove, and when they arrived, they saw the Buddha sitting calmly in contemplation under a tree in that grove, his body shining brightly, shining brightly from that place, satisfied with his food, not begging, and standing silently.

source_sentence: 彼等見已，詣向佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After they saw that, they went to the Buddha and when they arrived, they said to him, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 仁今何故不求食也？』
translation: Why aren't you seeking food now, sir?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼諸一切摩那婆言：『諸摩那婆！
translation: "At that point, the Buddha addressed all those maṇḍalas, saying, 'Maṇḍalas!

source_sentence: 我已被請。』
translation: I've been invited.'

source_sentence: 彼等問言：『大德沙門！
translation: They asked, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 是誰所請？』
translation: Who invited him?'

source_sentence: 佛即報言：『汝輩和上，已請我也。』
translation: The Buddha then replied, 'You Vajrasattvas, you've invited me.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等摩那婆心生於希有：『甚奇可怪！
translation: "At that point, those Manabha people's minds gave rise to a sense of wonder, 'How strange!'

source_sentence: 希有希有！
translation: I wish I had! I wish I had!

source_sentence: 此大沙門，然口不言，遙知他心。』
translation: 'This great ascetic, though he doesn't speak, knows the minds of others from afar.'

source_sentence: 彼等即大歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝。
translation: They then rejoiced greatly and jumped up and down, filling their bodies with joy, and they couldn't contain themselves.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等速疾迴還優婁頻螺迦葉之邊，到已白言：『尊者和上！
translation: "They then quickly returned to the side of Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, and when they arrived, they said, 'Venerable Kazuhiro!

source_sentence: 我決定知，此大沙門是一切智。
translation: 'I definitely know that this great ascetic is omniscient.

source_sentence: 和上以心默請於彼，彼即自知和上之心，亦向我語：「我已彼汝和上心請。」』
translation: He asked him to do so silently with his mind, and he knew of his own mind and said to me, 'I've asked you to do so with your mind.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉聞彼語已，即便鋪設大價之座。
translation: "After hearing his words, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa then proceeded to lay out a seat of great price.

source_sentence: 鋪設既訖，心發是念：『沙門瞿曇！
translation: After it was laid out, he thought, 'Gautama the ascetic!

source_sentence: 若仁今是一切智者，當應我念即現此座。』
translation: 'Now, if you're a man of omniscience, you will appear here on this throne in response to my thoughts.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知彼優婁頻螺迦葉心所念已，身應時現於彼座上。
translation: Knowing what that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was thinking, the Bhagavān then physically appeared on his throne in response.

source_sentence: 「爾時優婁頻螺迦葉，既見世尊在其座上端然而坐，見已歡喜，即以自手，將好種種餚饍飲食，持用施佛，所謂噉食唼[口*束]舐啜豐足自恣，復作是念：『希有希有！
translation: "Seeing the Bhagavān sitting upright on his throne, Urubiliputra Kāśyapa rejoiced when he saw that, and then he offered the Buddha a variety of good foods and foods with his own hands, which he called gnawing [mouth*bunch], licking, and slurping in abundance, and then he thought, 'Rarely, rarely!'

source_sentence: 此大沙門！
translation: This great brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 大有威神！
translation: Great is the authoritative power!

source_sentence: 大有德力！
translation: Great is the power of virtue!

source_sentence: 乃能知我心中所念；威神雖然，而猶不得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: Even though they know what's in my mind and have great authority, they still can't attain the fruit of the arhat like I do now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉邊受食訖，還迴至於差梨迦林，經行而住。
translation: "After he had received his meal at Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān returned to the Chāriputra forest and stayed there for a while.

source_sentence: 是時世尊身上所著袈裟之衣悉皆破壞，而彼兵將婆羅門村有於一家人命既終，即便林葬，是時，世尊於林見已，即自收取彼糞掃衣，取已世尊作是思念：『我今何處，洗於如是糞掃之衣，能使清淨？』
translation: The robe that the Bhagavān was wearing was completely destroyed, and that soldier general Brāhmaṇa was buried in the forest after his family's life had ended.

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋忉利天王既知世尊心意所念，知已即於彼之處所，以手掘地，造作一池，其水清淨，作已即便諮白佛言：『善哉！
translation: "After he knew what the Bhagavān had in mind, Śakra Devānām-Indra knew that he had dug his hand into the ground and made a pond whose water was pure, and after he had made it, he consulted the Buddha and said, 'Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願以此水洗糞掃衣。』
translation: May this water be used to wash and wash my robes.'

source_sentence: 是時，世尊見池水已，復如是念：『今雖得水，當於何上洗浣是衣？』
translation: After seeing the water in the pond, the Bhagavān then had another thought, 'Even though I have access to water now, on what will I wash and rinse this garment?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋知佛心已，從鐵圍山將一大石，安置佛前，置以白佛，作如是言：『唯願世尊！
translation: "After he knew the Buddha's mind, Śakra then took a large stone from Mount Tīrvais and placed it in front of the Buddha, saying, 'May it please the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於此石上洗蹋是衣。』
translation: 'Wash and dispose of this garment on this stone.'

source_sentence: 是時世尊，復如是念：『今雖得石，復當攀何洗蹋此衣？』
translation: The Bhagavān then again had this thought, 'Even though I've gotten the stone, how will I wash this robe again?'

source_sentence: 時彼池岸舊有一樹，名迦拘婆(隋言峯)。
translation: At the time, there was an old tree on the bank of that pond named Kakkuṭapāda (Sui word for peak).

source_sentence: 時彼樹間有一樹神，知佛意念，按樹一枝令垂向下，而白佛言：『唯願世尊！
translation: Knowing the Buddha's intention, a tree spirit in the midst of that tree pressed a branch of the tree to make it hang downward and said to the Buddha, 'May it please the Bhagavān!'

source_sentence: 攀此樹枝，洗蹋於是糞掃之衣。』
translation: Climbing on this tree's branches, he washed and spoiled his robe with this dung.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復如是念：『我洗衣已，復於何上，曝曬此衣？』
translation: The Bhagavān then again thought, 'After I wash this garment, on what else will I expose it to the sun?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋知佛心念，知已即從鐵圍山間，將一最大寬廣之石，安置佛前。
translation: "At the time, Śakra knew what the Buddha was thinking, and when he did, he took the largest and broadest stone from among the iron mountains and placed it in front of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 既安置已，即白佛言：『唯願世尊！
translation: Once he had placed it there, he said to the Buddha, 'May it be, Bhagavān!'

source_sentence: 於是石上，以用曬衣。』
translation: Here, on this stone, he used to dry his clothes in the sun.'

source_sentence: 是時世尊，即於石上曬糞掃衣。
translation: The Bhagavān then dried his robes on the stone in the sun.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: "After Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa had passed the night, he went to the Buddha, and when he arrived, he said to him, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 食時已至，辦具訖了。』
translation: The time for eating has arrived, and the preparations have been made.'

source_sentence: 又復白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Again, he said to the Buddha, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 已前此處無有是池，今日何故忽有此池？
translation: There was no such pond here before, but why does this pond suddenly exist today?

source_sentence: 此處已前無是二石，又從何來？
translation: These two stones did not exist here before, so where did they come from?

source_sentence: 其迦拘婆此樹已前，枝不垂下今日何緣如是嚲垂？
translation: Why is it that this tree's branches didn't hang down before this one, but today they're hanging open?

source_sentence: 不知何緣忽然如此？』
translation: I wonder why it's suddenly like this?'

source_sentence: 作是語已，默然不言。
translation: After saying this, he remained silent.

source_sentence: 佛告優婁頻螺迦葉作如是言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: The Buddha told Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa to say this, 'Kāśyapa, my lord!

source_sentence: 此處我得糞掃之衣，彼時我作如是心念：「以何浣此糞掃之衣？」
translation: After I had obtained this soiled garment, I thought, "How can I wash this soiled garment?"

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋知我心念，以手掘池出此池水，而白我言：「世尊！
translation: Knowing what I was thinking, Tīrṣa then dug his hand into the pond and drew out its water, saying to me, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今可以此池水洗糞掃衣。」
translation: Now, you can wash your dung and sweep your clothes with the water from this pond."

source_sentence: 以如是故，至今相傳，名為帝釋手掘之池。
translation: For this reason, it's been handed down from generation to generation as the pond that Tīrṣa dug by hand.

source_sentence: 得是水已，我復更作如是思念：「我於何上，蹋糞掃衣？」
translation: After obtaining this water, I then had this further thought, "On what would I wash my clothes of dirt and sweat?"

source_sentence: 「『爾時，帝釋知我心念，從鐵圍山，將一大石，來置此地，而白我言：「唯願世尊！
translation: "'Then, knowing what I was thinking, Tīrṣa brought a large stone from Mount Tīrvaipulya and placed it here, saying to me, "Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於此石上，用洗浣衣。」
translation: On this stone, I used to wash and rinse my clothes."

source_sentence: 是故此名非人擲石。
translation: This is called 'not a person tossing a stone.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，作如是念：「我手攀何而蹋是衣？」
translation: At the time, I thought, 'What did I do with this garment with my hand?'"

source_sentence: 「『爾時，彼樹迦拘婆神知我心念，以手按此樹枝令垂，而白我言：「唯願世尊！
translation: "'At the time, the god Kakuda knew what I was thinking, pressed his hand against a branch of the tree to make it hang, and said to me, "Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 手攀此枝，用脚蹋衣。」
translation: Climbing this branch with my hand, I step on my robe with my foot."

source_sentence: 以是因緣，此樹之枝如是懸垂。
translation: Because of this cause, the branch of this tree is thus hanging down.

source_sentence: 得於枝已，我如是念：「今於何上，曬於此衣？」
translation: After reaching the branch, I thought, "Where did I dry my robe on this branch?"

source_sentence: 「『爾時，帝釋知我心念，從鐵圍山，將此廣石，擲置我前，而白我言：「唯願世尊！
translation: "'Then, knowing what I was thinking, Tīrṣa came down from Mount Tīrvaipulya, threw this broad stone in front of me, and said to me, "Please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於此石上曬所浣衣。」
translation: 'This is a stone on which you wash your clothes in the sun.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣，此石名為非人所擲。』
translation: For this reason, this stone is called 'Thrown by inhumans.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門！
translation: "At the time, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa thought, 'This great ascetic!

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能令彼天主帝釋而來供承；變現雖然，但大沙門，理實未得阿羅漢果如我今也。』
translation: It was then that he was able to cause that god Indra to come and venerate him; although he might appear, he's really a great ascetic who hasn't yet attained the fruit of the arhat like I am today.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處食訖，迴還至林，經行而住。
translation: After finishing his meal at that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa's residence, the Bhagavān returned to the forest and stayed there for a while.

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After that night, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa went to the Buddha, and when he arrived, he said to him, 'Great ascetic!

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If you know the time, your meal will have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 是時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是言：『仁者迦葉！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and said, 'You, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝於前去，我即隨來。』
translation: Now, go ahead, and I'll follow you.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊既發遣彼優婁頻螺迦葉去已，即乘神通向須彌山。
translation: "After sending Ulūka Kāśyapa away, the Bhagavān then took his supernormal powers and headed for Mount Sumeru.

source_sentence: 是時彼山有閻浮樹，以彼閻浮樹因緣故，所以得此閻浮提名。
translation: There was then a jambu tree on that mountain, and it was because of that jambu tree that he had been able to nominate this jambu.

source_sentence: 於彼樹上，取得菓已，於先來至優婁頻螺迦葉居處火神堂中，端然而坐。
translation: After obtaining fruit from that tree, he went to the fire deity's hall where Ulūkaśālī Kāśyapa was staying and sat down upright.

source_sentence: 而彼優婁頻螺迦葉在後來，見如來坐於火神堂內，見已驚怪，即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: When that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa came after him and saw the Tathāgata sitting in the fire deity's hall, he was surprised and said to the Buddha, 'Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 仁從何道，而來至此？
translation: What path did benevolence take to get here?

source_sentence: 仁元在林，於我後發，即今何忽在我前，到此火神堂其中安坐？』
translation: Inwon was in the forest and started after me. Now, why has he suddenly come before me and settled down in this fire deity's hall?'

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『迦葉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我先發遣汝已，至須彌山，彼有一樹，名曰閻浮，因彼樹故，此今得是閻浮提名。
translation: After I sent you away, I went to Mount Sumeru, where there's a tree named Jambu, and because of that tree, I was able to nominate Jambu here.

source_sentence: 彼樹上菓，我今將來在此堂內。』
translation: The fruit from that tree I'll put in this hall in the future.'

source_sentence: 指示迦葉：『彼閻浮菓即此是也，顏色端正，香味微妙，食者甚美，汝今可取此之甘菓而噉食之。』
translation: He instructed Kāśyapa, 'This is the fruit of Jambudvī that's of fine color and has a subtle fragrance that's delicious when eaten.

source_sentence: 爾時迦葉即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: It was then that Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 此事不然，仁自合噉此之甘菓，我不應食。』
translation: Otherwise, you yourself should eat this sweet fruit, but I shouldn't.'

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉心如是念：『此大沙門，大有神通！
translation: It was then that Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa thought, 'This great ascetic has great supernormal powers!'

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 乃能於先發遣我已，其身自到須彌山，取閻浮菓，來此火神堂，於前而坐；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: After he sent me away, he himself went to Mount Sumeru, took some fruit, came to this fire deity's hall, and sat down in front of it; even though he couldn't have been an arhat like me today.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處食訖，速還向於林內經行。
translation: "After finishing his meal at that place where Ulūpiṃśvara Kāśyapa was staying, the Bhagavān quickly returned to the forest and walked around.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，至明清旦，往詣佛所，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After that night, Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa went to the Buddha in the early morning and said, 'Venerable monk!

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If you know the time, your meal will have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告迦葉言：『迦葉汝今且於先行，我隨後去。』
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa, go ahead now; I'll leave after you.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於先發遣迦葉去已，即復還自向須彌山，離閻浮樹相去不遠更有一樹，名菴婆羅。
translation: "After the Bhagavān had first sent Kāśyapa away, he then went back up Sumeru and found another tree named Ambala, not far from the Jambū trees.

source_sentence: 從菴婆羅，取得一菓，於先來到迦葉住處火神堂坐。
translation: From that tree, he obtained a fruit and went to sit in the fire deities' hall where Kāśyapa was staying.

source_sentence: 迦葉後來，見於世尊在火神堂安然而坐，見已白佛，作如是言：『大德沙門！
translation: When Kāśyapa came back and saw the Bhagavān sitting comfortably in the fire deity's hall, he said to the Buddha after he saw him, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 從何道來？
translation: How did it come about?

source_sentence: 在我前到此火神堂。』
translation: Go before me to this fire deity's hall.'

source_sentence: 「佛告迦葉：『我遣汝後，至須彌山，取得於是菴婆羅菓，將來在此，乃至先勸迦葉令食。』
translation: "The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'After I send you, go to Mount Sumeru and obtain this fruit of ambrosia for later use here, even before I encourage Kāśyapa to eat it.'

source_sentence: 迦葉白言：『我不合食。』
translation: Kāśyapa said, 'I won't eat it.'

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉心如是念：『此大沙門，大有神通！
translation: It was then that Ulūkaśaila Kāśyapa thought, 'This great ascetic has great supernormal powers!'

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 乃能於先發遣於我，到須彌山，取菓將來，於先而坐；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Perhaps he could have sent me up to Mount Sumeru, taken fruit, and sat down there beforehand, even though it wouldn't have been possible for an arhat like me to do so now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊於彼優婁頻螺迦葉居處食訖，還迴至彼林內經行。
translation: "After finishing his meal at that place where Ulūpiṃśvara Kāśyapa lived, the Bhagavān returned to that forest to walk around.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，至明清旦，往詣佛所，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: After that night, Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa went to the Buddha in the early morning and said, 'Venerable monk!

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If he knew the time, he would have finished his meal.'

source_sentence: 乃至去彼閻浮提樹處所不遠，有呵梨樹，將彼菓來，先到迦葉火神堂內，乃至沙門，大有神通，雖然猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。
translation: Not far from where that Jambudvīpa tree is, there's a pāri tree that brings fruit from that tree and brings it first to the fire deities' hall at Kāśyapa, even though it's an ascetic with great supernormal powers who's still not an arhat like me today.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行，乃至去彼閻浮提近，更有一樹，名毘醯勒，彼樹上取一菓，將來先到堂內。
translation: "After he finished eating, the Bhagavān went back to that forest and walked around until he reached Jambudvīpa, where there was another tree named Vihīlapatra that took a fruit from that tree and brought it into the hall first.

source_sentence: 乃至如前，此大沙門，大有神通，先遣我身，其後取菓，雖然猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。
translation: Even as before, this great ascetic with great supernormal powers first sent me away and then took the fruit, even though it wasn't quite an arhat like me now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行，乃至去彼閻浮提樹，更有一樹，名阿摩勒，彼樹取菓，於先將來，坐火神堂。
translation: "After he finished eating, the Bhagavān went back to that forest and walked around, even going to that Jambudvīpa tree and another tree named Amalā, which had taken the fruit and was sitting in the fire deities' hall in the future.

source_sentence: 乃至沙門，大有神通，先發遣我，身後將菓來火神堂，雖然猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。
translation: Even if that ascetic with great supernormal powers had sent me away and brought the fruit to the fire deities' hall after me, it wouldn't have been like an arhat like me now.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān returned to that forest to walk around.

source_sentence: 是時，優樓頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往詣佛所。
translation: After that night, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa went to the Buddha's place.

source_sentence: 到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: When he arrived, he said to the Buddha, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: If you know the time, the food will have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：『汝先且去，我隨後來。』
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'Go ahead and leave; I'll come after you.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊遣迦葉已，至瞿耶尼，到彼處已，乞乳滿鉢，在前來至火神堂內。
translation: After sending Kāśyapa, the Bhagavān then went to Gayāni, where he begged for milk to fill his bowl, and he went before him to the fire deities' hall.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉，見已白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa then saw him and said to the Buddha, 'Great ascetic!

source_sentence: 從何道來？
translation: How did it come about?

source_sentence: 在於我前，到此堂內。』
translation: Go before me and stay in this hall.'

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：『我遣汝後，到瞿耶尼，乞得是乳，滿此鉢中，在是而坐。
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'After I send you, go to Gayāni, ask for this milk, fill this bowl, and sit here.'

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 是乳顏色微妙，香氣甘美，汝意若樂，取此乳飲。』
translation: This milk is of a subtle color and has a delicious odor; if you wish, take this milk and drink it.'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『我不堪飲，沙門自飲。』
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'I'm not fit to drink it; the ascetic will drink it himself.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力！
translation: Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'This great ascetic is very powerful!

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃先遣我，其後身往瞿耶尼國，乞乳滿鉢，先來至此火神堂內；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: He first sent me, then he went to Gayāni, begged for milk and filled his bowl, and then he came to this fire deity's hall; even though he couldn't be an arhat like me now.'

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第四十一
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 41
